front.title: ISIS Extensions to support U-turn Alternates for IP/LDP Fast-Reroute

abstract.t: This document specifies additional information that can inserted in IS-IS LSPs to convey link capabilities that may be useful in certain applications. In particular, an IS may convey that zero or more of its links are explicit marked and/or implicit U-turn recipient capable, which may be described as capable of identifying traffic as U-turn traffic and redirecting the traffic to a suitable alternate. The immediate applicability for these two link capabilities is in support of local protection, provided by a U-turn alternate, in the event of a link and/or node failure while the IS-IS area is reconverging onto a new topology.
